column4: Hi - This is a dual boot partitioned windows/Intrepid installed running Gnome desktop - I want to read the Windows partition - I installed following - sudo apt-get install ntfs-config - Is this all I need - Or do I need to install Samba as well ? ?
you only need to configure your fstab file
Not sure how to to do that.... Point me in the right direction ?
you will need to identify the partion number of your windows partition.  Do you know how to do that?
I already have Windows on 1st partition - Just want to be able to get files from this partition to copy to my Intrepid folders.
so you only want to temporarily mount the windows partition?
ok, first open a terminal.  Type sudo fdisk -l
you should see one of the partitions as ntfs file system?
yup - If you like I can post screen shot ?
ok, no need, just make a mental note of the partition number  should be something like sda1
now, you will want to make a folder to mount too.  type sudo mkdir /media/windows
Hey - I already got it - Went to < Places/Computer - Clicked on DSK1_VOL1 and asked permission - entered password and let in to copy files - THanks for help.
